Reviews.Title: “Tucked away but a real gem”
Reviews.Author: BecAndCecil
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, with lovely and helpful staff. It's a little out of the way but very worth the hike. We were a but disappointed at getting one of the older rooms (we'd originally been given a key to one of the funky new rooms - but as we'd requested two beds they had to shift us) but even the older room was fine. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “December trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a last minute short break in Paris and before going I spent quite a bit of time researching hotels and finally settled on the Hotel Peyris. We arrived at Charles de Gaulle airport and caught the Roissy Bus (10 euros) to Opera which was just a 15 minute stroll to the hotel. The hotel proved to be an excellent choice - the location in Opera was a great starting point for getting to most tourist sights. We walked to most of the locations to make sure we saw all the sights. Going by Metro is fine if you accept that you only want to get from A to B and don't mind missing the sights (including excellent cafes/bistros en route). The hotel room (Superior) was very good (albeit a bit on the small side) but well decorated and clean. It would have been nice to have had tea/coffee making facilities in the room but not a major problem. The breakfast provided was excellent with plenty of choice and set in a very nice room. The hotel staff were very friendly and keen to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. We will certainly use this hotel on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: swissinfo
Reviews.Content: I came to Paris on a business trip and this hotel was booked by my employer, not really knowing what to expect, I found this hotel to be just the ticket to a safe and peaceful nights sleep, the staff at the hotel were very helpful and polite and also when asked they offered plenty of advice on where to dine at night and also warning you to beware of the some of the not so nice persons such as drunks & vagrants walking around the streets, I was very pleased to have a nice continental breakfast and on my departure the staff at the front desk were only too willing to assist with any further assistance if required, it a shame I did not get to try the bars, but oh well may next?

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but very good”
Reviews.Author: Martyn C
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of the photos on their website and the deal we got through Thomas cook. There is nothing wrong with the hotel, but my only gripe is their site doesn't make it clear which type of room you are booking, made worse for us as we booked through an agent and even less control. There is a new wing with the modern rooms and an older wing with more basic rooms. We ended up with a basic room. But... The hotel is very nice, the staff are friendly and all spoke good english. The room (although basic) was clean, comfortable and of a reasonable size. Large bed with good bedding, a nice balcony overlooking the street, good storage and perfectly adequate facilities. Some things about the hotel's location: it's well siutated within Paris and within easy access of the main attractions. Nearest metro is about 10 minutes walk, but serves line 8, a very central and useful line. Gare du nord is an easy 20 minute stroll away, perfect for eurostar customers. The street and immediate area is bustling and lively (maybe not a positive for some). Overall, very little negatives to the hotel. We are young couple 25 & 20 and stayed for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, beautiful rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Katie7S
Reviews.Content: We came here for a birthday this year, 3 of us shared a room and it was comfortable and lovely! Te rooms were modern and clean, and the bathrooms were a good size, with a bath which was a nice size, and the room had a big tv, good wardrobe and also wonderful big windows, which let in natural light. It also had a desk which was nice to sit at when having something to eat or do. The breakfast was reasonable - nothing special and there should be more chocolate croissants, and a bit more of a selection. The lift was small but good, although my mother did get stuck in it (went to level 2, and the door wouldn't open, but managed to get out by clicking button on outside thankfully!) it was a funny but also frightening experience, but this never happened after this, just think something weird happened! The staff were very friendly and were very helpful. There wasn't a great view from the room, but we were on the first floor of rooms and was overlooking the canopy below, and was a typical city like hotel and was nicer than we expected. The location was a little out of the central roads and shops, however, we found this quite nice as it was only a little walk to the main bus and metro, and wasn't too noisy at night either, unlike hotels which were on the main roads. I would highly recommend this hotel for anybody staying for a few nights, we stayed 3 nights, and didnt have any major problems or unhappiness with this hotel. We had a good, comfortable stay and would return! The rooms were beautifully decorated!

Reviews.Title: “A good little hotel suited for seasoned travellers”
Reviews.Author: JimmySydney01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Peyris for 8 nights during my trip to Paris in July. The room given to me must have been one of the "old" rooms as it didn't look anything like some of the photos on trip advisor or on other hotel booking websites, but having said that, I had no complaint as everything in the room worked just fine without any fault at all. There was no issues with the cleanliness of the room and the daily housekeeping was efficient, no fault at all. The room was "small" but hey, this is Paris, and considering the very good (cheap) rate (breakfast included) I paid for my room, I was more than happy. I thought it was a good value for money. I found the staff members (especially the front office) very helpful and flexible. I arrived very early in the morning and when I filled in my registration card and left my luggage in the luggage room and was just about to go out and about, thinking I would kill half a day until my room would be ready that afternoon, the gentleman who had checked me in told me I was welcome to have breakfast in the breakfast room! A very nice surprise as the breakfast inclusion was to kick in the following morning. I had my first breakfast in Paris (this was my very first trip to Paris) in the very cosy breakfast room, thanks to the staff member and his kindness and attentiveness. The food selection on the buffet wasn't that extensive but I was just satisfied with nice croissants and coffee on offer every day. The location of the hotel was good too as it only took me 5~10 minutes to Grands Boulevards metro station as well as Paris North Station (I took a Thalys train to Bruxelles one day), and even to the Louvre Museum, I could walk in 20~25 minutes. It also took me about 15~20 minutes on foot to get to Galeries Lafayette from the hotel. I have to say, for those who would like to stay right next door to L'Opera or in the middle of Les Halles, no, Hotel Peyris Opera may not provide an ideal location but for well-travelled holiday-makers, I would highly recommend this hotel as their base whilst in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manueli1987
Reviews.Content: Was qtaying in this hotel and must say never again!! The receptios is so non welcoming , very rude ant cannot be flexible with our demand. Also, a lack of responsability taken by the girl serving us. Ask me to pay in advance for the journey- redicillious. Not reccomended at all- never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: noelglee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Peyris for 12 days (yes 12!) from Sept 22nd to Oct 4th 2011. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fine. There is a nice French salon available to guests just past the Reception area. The location is good, not far from the Boulevard Bonne Nouvelle area which is always lively. A ten minute walk to the Grands Boulevards Metro gives access to the rest of Paris. Note that tickets are not available from the Bonne Nouvelle Metro. All in all I would recommend the Hotel Peyris.

Reviews.Title: “BEST AVOIDED”
Reviews.Author: Faisal333
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel during our stay in Paris - didnt get any other hotel because of the Paris Air Show. The hotel doesnt have any proper staff - only 3 people handling the whole property - receptionist at the front desk and the 2 cleaning staff. Very small elevator - big enough for 1 adult or luggage. Shabby corridors. Avoid if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Bob-Maria
Reviews.Content: I went for a mid-week break for three nights with my wife and daughter. The hotel is situated in a maze of back streets near the opera district. At first I found these streets intimidating at night but they turned out quite charming and full of hidden cafe bars and small restruants. I felt very safe and comfortable late at night. We ended eating and drinking in the area. The hotel was very French ie.( small ) with a secure, clean, and quiet room. The weather made it very warm at night and the air con worked a treat. The breakfast was included in our stay and it was ok, not great but in my experience the French don't do breakfast like the Irish ! Overall a nice hotel that I stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Mike186411
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a 3 day break in Paris with my wife and son , our first visit to Paris Saw lots of comment about the location of the hotel in relation to the Metro so as there were 3 of us we got a taxi from CDG Airport for 40 Euros. The Hotel itself is as reported ie shabby corridors but perfectly acceptable refurbished rooms with a reasonable size bathroom. The windows were double glazed and kept out any noise from the street. We found all the staff very helpfull and also thought that the continental buffet breakfast was very good with all the variety of foods that could reasonably be expected. As regards the hotels location in Paris (in relation to tourist attractions) we did what lots never mention we walked everywhere and had no problems finding our way ! Sacre Cour was 25 mins and the Seine / Notre Dame approx 35 mins. The area around the hotel is not the busiest but if you walk there were plenty of places available. In August quite a number of restaurants / businesses were closed but we had no problems finding places to eat / drink. Food and drink is a large part of our holidays and i must say that we were very disappointed with the quality of what we ate despite going to quite expensive traditional and modern restaurants. Drink also was very expensive with even mediocre (French, there is no other choice) wine costing over 20 Euros at even basic bars. With regard to Paris we found it expensive and despite the grand boulevards / impressive buildings somehow lacking in character . Also agree with another reviewer about how many beggars are on the (often dirty) streets.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, good location”
Reviews.Author: MakingBubbles
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room on the first floor. The room was a good size, the beds were comfortable and it was clean. The buffet breakfast was great. The staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay here, thought it was good value for money, and we would stay here again. The area around the hotel was quiet. It was quite a long walk with suitcases from the nearest metro station. If you have a lot of luggage I would recommend getting a taxi. Without luggage it was only about 5 minutes to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Robbery 101 - beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracyez
Reviews.Content: SO, yes this can happen to anyone, anywhere...but as my family and I came back into our room after breakfast we happen upon a strange man in our bathroom....long story short the reason why we got our property back was because of our own pat down and hold of the guy. The hotel NEVER tried to retain the man...and in fact he escaped...hmmm inside job you ask? Breakfast sucked too...bad neighborhood...We ended up moving to St. Germaine and found a wonderful hotel Relais St. Germaine for LESS than this place...do your self a favor and stay somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “wont ever go back”
Reviews.Author: fabric40
Reviews.Content: travelled to Paris and stayed overnight at this hotel before travelling the following day to Switzerland. The first stop over on the 17.7.2011 room no. 219 was ok. However, on the 25.7.2011 (room no. 328) it was a terrible experience. The family room (2 kids, 2 adults), the bathroom door wouldnt shut, there was no shower curtain or screen so water went everywhere. The milk at breakfast was definately off and to finish our stay my daughter found a mouse in the hotel lobby! The area surrounding the hotel is noisy. We were incredibly disappointed with Paris, and found it to be a dirty, graffiti ridden city and it made us proud to be British for once! The walk from the Gare de L'Est and Gare de Nord to and from the hotel was an experience. Lots of beggars in the street, gangs hanging around corners and rubbish everywhere. I am sure there are better places to stay in Paris for an overnight trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Not Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KMoor
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Hotel Peyris was quite large and perfectly suited our family of 4...the hotel is clean and well managed. The breakfast was sufficient. The reason I will not return to the Hotel Peyris is its location. Of course it is close (5 blocks) to a metro station, but it is not on a convenient line for sightseeing...In order to get to and from our destinations in a more efficient manner, we ended up walking a considerable distance to another metro station. Lesson learned: being close to a metro station does not mean you are within easy reach of your destinations. Always check which subway lines run thru said station before making reservations...

Reviews.Title: “Difficult first 4 days, better last 5 days”
Reviews.Author: Patrick059
Reviews.Content: Negative: upon arrival, we're told the bed type we asked for was not available, and had to argue for it. They said bed type was not guaranteed and subject to availability. (Why are more hotels operating this way now?) Positive: in the end, they did make the bed type available. Negative: broken hairdryer took 2 days to fix with scotch tape. As the hotel's website said the rooms had a hairdryer, we did not bring our own. Negative: on the second night, the air conditioning on our floor broke down. We had specifically looked for a hotel with AC as Paris can get very hot in the summer. Still not working after 2 days and not knowing when it would be back up and running, we had to ask for another room. Positive: hotel looked for another room in the same building and its sister hotel, and was able to change our room, but it was a hastle. Negative: while changing rooms, we got stuck in the elevator, on the 4th day. Positive: the last 5 days of our trip were problem free. Positive: very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: MICHELK1
Reviews.Content: Great location,clean rooms,very friendly staff-stayed there with our whole family,3 rooms,a real boutique hotel,definitely good value for the price...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Parisluvver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is contemporary and yet is comfortable and excellent value. Having air conditioned rooms and a beautifully firm bed made the visit a joy. The "buffet style" breakfast made a welcome change to the more normal continental breakfast and had a vast choice on offer. Staff were courteous and friendly. Only downside was a fair amount of noise in the morning from other rooms - slamming doors, noisy water pipes; hearing the bathroom next to us peeing etc.... If soundproofing was added, this hotel would be virtually perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm1248
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great ! The staff right down to the cleaners where helpfull and very pleasent. The location is great , lots of bars , restaurants . The grand boulevard and metro are very close . Good breakfast and spotless rooms with great decor . I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Tiny Rooms plus NO WAKE UP CALLS!”
Reviews.Author: xxalinkaxx
Reviews.Content: Staying in a second hotel on a recent Paris trip [See my review of BEST WESTERN Etoile Saint Honore], this one was worse on a few fronts. First of all the room was nicely designed but extremely small and I am not that Big! The location is a little bit quieter and not in the action so if a good night of sleep is important this place is not bad. The worst thing that happened twice during the 2 nights I stayed was the wake up call not going off. I specifically asked for one to get an early start on sightseeing but ended up waking up at 11:30am in my dark room. Having asked the concierge about it, they said the morning attendant forgot to call. The next morning i was leaving on an international flight and said this could not happen again but of course once again they did not call! Luckily one of the front desk people knowing that i was leaving came up to my room and knocked as the alarm but too bad i only had 15 minutes to pack and get out!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in a great location in paris with clean and newly renovated room.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the positive and negative reviews and decided to booked the hotel in advance. I had difficulty finding hotels in the middle of Paris that can accomodate 4 of us without burning my credit card, but then I found Peyris Hotel. I was sceptical at first because normally I stayed in well known hotel chain but it didn't disappoint me. I love walking at night on the small streets, very near to almost everything, train station, metro, city carrefour, restaurants, laundry (all about 5 minutes walk), hard rock cafe and other main attractions. My wife was not happy though, she complained about the room lacked of place to hang our jackets and clothes and I think the small lift freaked her out. I would like to recommend the hotel to all, especially family of four. BTW, the hotel staffs were very nice and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “We miss Peyris”
Reviews.Author: Sergei_and_Natalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice (in 2008 and 2010, both times in May), and our second choice of Hotel Peyris was done deliberately. Among the advantages of the hotel we can mention: extremely helpful and professional staff (best wishes to Christian, Elena and Irina), perfect location of the Hotel (rue Conservatoire is a calm street and you can rest nicely after intensive all-day promenade round Paris (of course if you prefer 24-hour noise, this is not your hotel) and, at the same time, enjoy good accessibility to major tourist attractions), very close to underground stations (5-7 min to Grands Boulevards, 7-10 min to Cadet and about 10 min to Bonne Nouvelle), and rather substantial continental breakfast. Both times we had a room on the 5th floor with a view to the street, and it was great to see the sunrise engoldening the roofs of Paris. Even a tiny lift in the hotel has its own charm. Thank you for your perfect service, and in case we go to Paris next year, we will undoubtedly choose this hotel which we can recommend most wholeheartedly to everyone who wants to feel real Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Could not find any fault with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miriam019
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent. But would like a kettle in room, as been Irish we love our cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: mojacScotland
Reviews.Content: Only required a 1 night stopover in Paris and was lucky enough to find this hotel. Small rooms but this was not a problem. Rooms very clean. Staff very helpful in providing comprehensive directions to the stations that we required. Breakfast typical of what we have had before in other hotels in Paris. My only observation was that I would have liked tea and coffee facilities available in the room, but no major problem. Would have happily stayed for longer, and will return there again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Shamrovers
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the not so good reviews of the Peyris and I just can't agree.Maybe you could say the rooms are a bit small but are impeccably clean.We asked for and got adjoining rooms for our teenagers(whoe room was bigger than ours),the staff were so friendly and helpful and the the breakfast was more than adequate.For a couple travelling in Paris this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A kip”
Reviews.Author: maryfCork_10
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel as bad as this. The 'twin beds' were two foot six wide, too narrow to turn in. There was no space to put cases or clothes. The room was beside the fire escape and the locks on the doors weren't great. There wasn't enough room for two people to pass on the corridors. I can't see how such place was passed by the fire authorities. This place should be avoided at all costs. I would prefer to stay at home if I was given a free holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandaflop
Reviews.Content: we had read a lot of reviews on line and dreaded going to the hotel. let me just say, forget the bad reviews. the hotel is 5mins walk to the metro which will get you anywhere you want to go, if your unsure ask at reception and they will help you as much as possible(service and politeness like iv never seen). yes the lift is small, but big enough to fit 2 people, one case and 2 carry on bags at a squeeze. a lot of reviews say the rooms are too small, and yes while the rooms are not big, they do exactly what they are ment to, provide a place to sleep, rest and wash. if you are going to paris to spend the whole time in your room then go to the ritz, in reality you will be out exploring the city all day. also very few rooms have singles pushed together as a double bed. the area is very safe, it seemed to be a jewish community. there are plenty of restaurants(including the hard rock cafe) close at hand as well as supermarches and bakerys(again just ask at reception). there was a little light renovation going on however work only proceeds in the afternoons so as not to wake guests. in conclusion, this is a hotel i would happily (& intend to) return to, i would recommend this to anyone looking for a hotel in the middle of the city with reasonable rates. the only down side was i couldnt access the local wifi on my ipod, however this was a small problem as i used my phone also there are internet cafes close by. the breakfast that is included is very filling, i personnally stuck to pastrys and cereals, however they do offer cold meats and eggs as well as juice, tea and coffee. for an experience, eat breakfast in a local bakery, you wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday surprise”
Reviews.Author: elaine20
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is nice looking and the staff there are excellent. the rooms are tiny but clean. as everyone has said the lift is amazing in that it is so small. the breakfast room is big enough and the continental breakfast is very good with cereal, meat, cheese , and bread that is really gorgeous. also clffee,tea & juice. the location is also not bad in that you are only about 15min walk from the opera area & you can get the bus tour here. The bus tour is really great value for money. Paris is a lovely city. My only problem would be that the rooms are to small in the hotel for me to recommend this hotel. Also the tv is in french.

Reviews.Title: “rooms drag this hotel down”
Reviews.Author: benbgood
Reviews.Content: really wanted to like this hotel but the rooms are a disgrace,they are clean,but they are tiny and stuffy and in bad need of a face lift,the first room we were given was no bigger than the back of a transit van and thats no exaggeration,,i complained and we were moved to a bigger room but it was grubby, bile yellow padded wallpaper that was coming away from the wall in places,lights were broken and hanging by exposed wires,bed clothes were like somthin from a prison bed..they make a point of stating the rooms are soundproof,why? i dont know,because they are far from it,its a real pity because the downstairs of the hotel is lovely with lots of character,the staff are great,very friendly and accommodating,location is good for night-life and shopping but is far from the big tourist attractions which we didnt mind because we love walking,theres no excuse for the condition of the rooms,because it wouldnt take much to freshin them up and take the depressing look off them,if the rooms were improved this hotel could be a little gem

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as i expected.”
Reviews.Author: jenzer88
Reviews.Content: The Peyris Hotel was our little Valentines getaway to Paris, We stayed there for a week the boyfriend picked it as it was a suprise (he hasnt a clue when it comes to stuff like this) After i read the reviews i was expecting it to be horrific but we really enjoyed our stay, Metro station only 5 minutes walk away. Used the metro loads, really easy way to travel. to be honest the rooms are basic the tv is all in french unless the discovery channel tickles your fancy. there is a bed tv very small bathroom no bath just a shower it is a fair bit away to the eiffel tower and the main paris attractions but they are all easy to get to. We made the most of it. The breakfast was crossaints,cereal or bread thats it take your pick i was not its number one fan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Parisienne with lots of character.”
Reviews.Author: marymary26
Reviews.Content: Liked the ambience. Hotel Peyris is very Parisienne, not central but very close to the Opera - a stop on the Hop on hop off tour bus. Staff are friendly , helpful and rooms while small were spotless. The lift is very quaint and in keeping with the atmosphere of the hotel. Paris is very expensive for beer and teas but the local cafes offered great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Its Grand”
Reviews.Author: BootzB
Reviews.Content: This was my wedding present from my hubby. I read the reviews and was worried about staying there. We unfortunaltley had to stay there for 1 whole week. The toilet was in the hall the bathroom was bigger then the room and the room itself was fairly rough. there was a double bed from the 1930's. The telly only showed CNN. We enjoyed the walk to the city as it was nice enough and also its a 15 min walk to the sacre soeur. It is two minutes from the famous follie bergers. Its a mainly working class jewish area. The bed clothes on the bed were horrible but they had the room spotless every morning. We had breakfast included and it was typical continental. One piece of advice go on to Boulevard hausmann and eat at the Hard Rock Cafe, I know you might think its overated but we got a massive sirloin steak and gorgeous cheddar mashed spuds for €21.95 we ate there a lot. Will not be returning to paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressive!”
Reviews.Author: South84
Reviews.Content: just back from 3 night stay in Peyris, not too impressed! We had read reviews before we went but we had hoped the bad reviews were from very fussy travelers!! the room was clean but tiny, the bathroom was the same tiny but very clean, the bed was horrible,felt like sheets hadn't been changed in a while or else the mattress was damp! CNN is the only English channel! It's in a very quiet area a good 15 min walk from any touristy stuff! the reception staff are friendly and very helpful. Perfect for budget traveler's but i wouldn't recommend for a romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Peyris”
Reviews.Author: LozzaCornwall
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our honeymoon in Paris, and due to budget, we decided to stay at the Peyris. Really enjoyed our stay, Metro station only 5 minutes walk away. Used the metro loads, really easy way to travel. Arrived at the hotel early morning, and locked our luggage away until we checked in later on. Friendly staff, and yes, the lift is very small, and claustrophobic, so we opted for the stairs!! Nice size room with terrace, and typical continental breakfast, plenty of it too!! Bar was small and quiet, but lovely, well priced wine!!Was worried by reviews i had seen, but it was great. Clean, comfortable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “best for a quick stop over”
Reviews.Author: pigni
Reviews.Content: This hotel yes on the ouside is quitte charming but on the inside its not. The lift is n ot big enough to fit a suitcase and a person. Forget getting into the shower if your a tad bit large- our view was of a green mouldy square area not very appealing. The bed was ok. The tv was good if you are fluent in french or love cnn.The staff were quite nice .The area itself was very quite except from the noisy people in the room next door.Not far fom local shops and touirst attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Average tourist stuff”
Reviews.Author: Ewsp
Reviews.Content: Peyris seems to be popular with Russian tourists. Pros: Friendly staff, air conditioning, bathroom in excellent condition, breakfast ok. Cons: Very dull room with poor lighting, narrow and dark corridors, street noise, need a taxi (e.g. from Gare du Nord) if you have heavy luggage because Metro stations are quite a distance away.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Peyris Opera
HotelInfo.Address: 10, rue du Conservatoire | 9th Arr., 75009 Paris, France
